Module kivakit.core.kernel
Package com.telenav.kivakit.core.kernel.language.io

Class LookAheadReader

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.io.Reader
      • com.telenav.kivakit.core.kernel.language.io.LookAheadReader
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Closeable, java.lang.AutoCloseable, java.lang.Readable
    public class LookAheadReader
extends java.io.Reader
    A simple stream that allows you to peek at what is coming next in an input stream.
    Author:
    jonathanl (shibo)

    • Method Detail

      • atEndOfLine

        public boolean atEndOfLine()
        Checks whether the input stream is at the end of line. Note that when the method returns true the stream should be pointing to the line terminator, 0x0A.
        Returns:
        true if the input stream is at the end of a line, false otherwise.

      • close

        public void close()
        Specified by:
        close in interface java.lang.AutoCloseable
        Specified by:
        close in interface java.io.Closeable
        Specified by:
        close in class java.io.Reader

      • current

        public final int current()
        Returns:
        The current character in the stream or END_OF_STREAM if the stream is out of input

      • hasNext

        public final boolean hasNext()
        Returns:
        True if the stream can be advanced with next()

      • lineNumber

        public int lineNumber()

      • lookAhead

        public int lookAhead()
        Calling this method does not advance the stream.
        Returns:
        The next value (looking ahead) in the stream.

      • next

        public final void next()
        Moves the stream to the next value

        public int read​(char[] buffer,
                int offset,
                int length)
